alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 3:14PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Floyd and Pike. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 314 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prestonsburg, Heenan, Jarad, Moree, Threeforks, Piso, Gulnare, McCombs, Laura, Varney, Heisey, Conder, Endicott, Hatfield Station, Rural, Whitepost, Oppy, Ivel, Alvin and Corn Fork Hollow. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
